title: Blue Ridge Parkway: Craggy Gardens
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go     Popular Destinations     Craggy Gardens                Craggy Gardens          Craggy Gardens is an appropriate name here with the twisted, jagged, rocky "crags" giving the place its name. At over 5,000 feet elevation, harsh weather often invades these exposed ridges, resulting in the gnarled forests of beech, birch, and buckeye. These summits are home to the most spectacular rhododendron displays along the Parkway corridor. For generations, visitors have headed up to the Craggies in mid to late June to view the pink and purple blooms. A popular picnicking spot, the Craggies is an especially good place for stargazing. Mount Mitchell State Park, the highest mountain east of the Mississippi, is close by.
